to publish the interview questions online because one of the things that I
found over a lot of time hiring people at various companies people from different backgrounds is that a lot of
the people who come to the interview don't speak English as their native language and so when you ask them a
question they are hearing the question in English they are translating it to
their native language they are getting an answer together and then they are translating it by back into English in
order to convey it to you and I think that that often puts nonnative speakers
of English at an unfair disadvantage so by putting the questions online then
you're able to remove that unfair uh disadvantage you're leveling the playing field and I think this is an act of

repo we have the initial screen questions where they're all there now there are a few things that we do

we also ask questions where it's not easy to memorize and answer it's very
much a behavior type of interviews like tell me about a time where you were behind on something at work uh and you

understand the role you can ask is this position that I'm interviewing for is it

that I wish I knew when I started hiring uh when I started going through the process of um trying to find a job is
the first offer is usually not the best offer and I think that a lot of people
don't understand this that a company has a certain budget range in mind for every
role now the good news is that due to laws in various countries and even in the US they're starting to put the
salary range in the job description so they say this role in this location the
salary range is between this and this so that's great information to have if you have that information that's gold that
you should really uh use but what we're trying to do when we're trying to hire
you is that we're trying to calibrate where you are on that range now a lot of companies we don't do this explicitly
but we have a limited budget for the people that we're trying to hire so we want to offer you a offer
that is within what we think you'll take but it's probably not going to be the higher offer because if you take the
lower offer well then that's great right we get the same person during the role
for less money and that's just something we don't say out loud but what you can do is that you can always negotiate you
can always negotiate now when I say negotiate I'm talking about total compensation does anyone know what total
compensation is right because a lot of people think about compensation as salary but the money you make from a a
company is way more than salary there are any stock that you get there might be a signing bonus you may be able to
negotiate working from home you may be able to get a home office dipen because you may need to hey I'm working remotely
I need to buy a new monitor for my home office these are all things that should be described in that offer so when you
get that offer what you can do is if the salary isn't what you're looking for you
can negotiate the other aspects of your total comp so you can and I typically do this in email I say
okay well the salary that you offered is a little bit less than what I was expecting it's not in line with what I
think I can offer but if the signing bonus is changed from 20,000 to 30,000 I
think that I can work with that or you or if a company says you can work from home on Fridays you can say well the
salary is not really what I'm looking for if I can work from home on Mondays and Fridays then I think that that's a
fair exchange and so by giving them options then you can see what they respond to and often that will tell you
where there's wigle room because often if they can't budge on the salary number
they can often budge on things like the signing bonus you can negotiate more stock you can do all these things to get
a to Total compensation package that works for you now again you've all worked at companies so I think you've
all that you've all been through this but I always try to remind people that everything is negotiable everything is
negotiable you just have to take the time to negotiate I've developed way better offers over my career by
negotiating the components of my total compensation in the offer all right so

know is activity and impact are not the same again this is something I wish I
knew year three or four of my career because it's really easy to just put

impact is everything so when you're working on your brag do it's really important to list the things that had

going what you're doing is that you're creating a a an in real time contemporaneous log of what you've done

process was weak and so I worked to work with the team to come up with an issue

and so I reduce the average per of time from X to Y right that's impact and so
by keeping that brag do you're making it really easy when it comes time to do the
